Changing the Working Folder

Although your StarTeam Administrator sets the initial working folder for the root folder of a view and its child folders, you may prefer to specify a shorter path for a particular folder or use a different drive letter. Remember that a working folder must point to a physically discrete location, such as a drive on your workstation or a personal directory on a shared file server. Borland does not recommend putting your settings on a mapped network drive.

You can change the working folder used for a StarTeam child folder in three ways:

  • By changing the default working folder designated for the StarTeam folder.

  • By using an alternate working folder.

  • By changing the alternate working folder.

However, changing your working folder can cause file status information to be lost. That's why it is advisable to check in modified and new files before performing this operation. You can then check the files out to the new location without any loss of information.

If you move a working folder from one location to another on your hard drive and then change the working folder in StarTeam, the status of most files in the working folder will change to Unknown. This change cannot be corrected by using File > Update Status. However, you can perform a force check out to obtain the tip revisions (which would overwrite any edits made to these files on your workstation) or make your working files the tip revisions.

To determine the current working folder for a StarTeam folder:

    Do one of the following:

    • Select the StarTeam folder, then select Folder > Properties from the menu.

    • Right-click the StarTeam folder in the folder hierarchy and select Properties from the context menu.

    The Folder Properties dialog displays the path in the Complete Working Folder Path box.

To change the working folder used for a StarTeam folder:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • If the default working folder has changed, note the files that you need to check in.

    • If you are creating a new alternate working folder or changing the existing alternate working folder, check in the files that need to be checked in before making the change.

  2. Select the StarTeam folder from the folder hierarchy.

  3. Select Properties from the Folder or context menu. The Folder Properties dialog opens.

  4. Select the Name tab.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • Select the Default option button and the new default working folder path.

    • Select the Alternate option button. Enter a relative path or enter or browse for an absolute path to the working folder.

  6. Click Close.

  7. Check out the files to your new working folder.

  8. (If required) Copy the files on your workstation that should have been checked in before the working folder changed and check them in.

Note: If your StarTeam administrator changes the default working folder, check out your files to the new working folder, then use Windows Explorer to copy any files that you have modified or created in the original folder to the new location.
